artist: Artist: Natori Shunsen; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: male figure, LRC, wearing blue and white dot-patterned kimono; female figure, L, wearing blue and pink patterned kimono; grey ground
markings: red artist\'s seal: 春仙 {Shun Sen} | LRC, artist\'s hand-applied red approval seal: 名取 {Natori} | CR, red collector seal: 末久壽宇恵留 {Matsuhisa Juu Eru}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Creative Prints: Collected Portraits by Shunsen (Sōsaku hanga: Shunsen nigao-e shū 創作版画　春仙似顔画集)
text: Twenty-third design of a set of 36. Actors Ichikawa Shōchō II (1886-1940) as Umegawa and Kataoka Gadō XII (1882-1946) as Chūbei in the play "A Message of Love from Yamato" (Koi bikyaku Yamato orai 恋飛脚大和往来). Chūbei is in love with the prostitute Umegawa and embezzles public money entrusted to him to buy her contract. The couple then decides to commit ritual suicide together before Chūbei can get arrested.
title: Actors Ichikawa Shōchō II as Umegawa and Kataoka Gadō XII as Chūbei
